A: 1. Words that name people, places, things, and animals are called _ (a) verbs (b) nouns (c) pronouns
2. Which of these is an example of a person noun? (a) school (b) book (c) teacher
3. A word naming a specific person like 'John' is a _ noun (a) common (b) proper (c) collective
4. 'City' is an example of a _ noun (a) proper (b) common (c) abstract
5. Which type of noun refers to a group? (a) common (b) proper (c) collective
6. 'Family' is a _ noun (a) common (b) collective (c) abstract
7. Nouns that cannot be touched or seen but can be felt are _ nouns (a) proper (b) common (c) abstract
8. 'Peace' is an example of a(n) _ noun (a) collective (b) abstract (c) common
9. Words that take the place of a noun are called _ (a) verbs (b) pronouns (c) adjectives
10. 'She' and 'they' are examples of _ pronouns (a) possessive (b) personal (c) action
11. Which type of pronoun shows ownership? (a) personal (b) possessive (c) linking
12. 'Mine' and 'theirs' are examples of _ pronouns (a) personal (b) possessive (c) action
13. Words that show action are called _ (a) nouns (b) verbs (c) pronouns
14. Which of these is an action verb? (a) is (b) seems (c) run
15. 'Think' is an example of a(n) _ verb (a) linking (b) action (c) helping
16. Verbs that connect the subject to additional information are _ verbs (a) action (b) linking (c) helping
17. 'Appears' is a type of _ verb (a) action (b) linking (c) helping
18. Which word is a common noun? (a) London (b) Google (c) book
19. 'Cat' is an example of a(n) _ (a) proper noun (b) common noun (c) abstract noun
20. A word like 'us' is a _ pronoun (a) possessive (b) personal (c) collective
B: 1. What part of speech names people, places, things, and animals? _________
3. What type of noun represents a group of people or things? _________
4. What part of speech replaces a noun in a sentence? _________
5. What type of verb shows physical or mental action? _________
C: 2. Give an example of a proper noun.
3. Give an example of an abstract noun.
5. Give an example of an action verb.
